intro: Viguieranthus longiracemosus, commonly known as the long-branch flowering plant, is a member of the Rubiaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, often climbing stems and clusters of small, fragrant flowers. The plant produces white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in terminal racemes, giving it its species name. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a slightly hairy texture. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and thrives in humid, shaded environments.
